verses.roman:
kaṭaka haite patrī dila sārvabhauma-ṭhāñi
prabhura ājñā haya yadi, dekhibāre yāi

synonyms: kaṭaka haite—from Kaṭaka, the capital of Orissa; patrī—a letter; dila—sent; sārvabhauma—of Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya; ṭhāñi—to the place; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; ājñā—order; haya—there is; yadi—if; dekhibāre yāi—I can go and see.
translation: The King sent a letter from his capital, Kaṭaka, to Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya, entreating him to obtain the Lord's permission so that he could go and see Him.
